meanings.sent1: The puppy was very tractable and quickly learned to sit when told.
meanings.sent2: The students found the assignment to be quite tractable and completed it without difficulty.
meanings.sent3: The robot was so tractable that it even cleaned up its own messes!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a tractable river, flowing smoothly in the direction she desired.
meanings.sent5: The key to success is to have a tractable approach to challenges, adapting easily to new situations.

meanings.definition: Capable of being shaped or molded
meanings.sent1: The clay was so tractable that the sculptor could create intricate designs with ease.
meanings.sent2: The young minds of children are incredibly tractable, ready to absorb knowledge and experiences.
meanings.sent3: The tractable dough in the baker's hands turned into delicious bread in no time.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were as tractable as clay, ready to be molded into innovative solutions.
meanings.sent5: In the hands of a skilled artist, even the most tractable material can become a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Able to be easily influenced or persuaded
meanings.sent1: His opinion on the matter was quite tractable and changed with each new argument presented.
meanings.sent2: The young child's mind was so tractable that she believed anything her older sister told her.
meanings.sent3: The tractable politician seemed to agree with everyone, causing confusion among the voters.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were as tractable as the wind, shifting direction with the slightest influence.
meanings.sent5: In a world of constant persuasion, it is important to remain tractable yet firm in one's beliefs.
